bibl.title: Report from Walter Reed to the Adjutant General, July 31, 1900

div1.p: Reed reports his duties for the month of July 1900 as President of the Board of Officers investigating infectious diseases and yellow fever. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Report from Walter Reed to the Adjutant General, July 31, 1900
div1.opener:
Columbia Barracks, Cuba.
July 31" 1900.
To the
Adjutant General, U.S. Army.
Washington D,C.
Sir:.
div1.p:
I have the honor to report myself on duty during the month of July
1900 at Columbia Barracks, Cuba, as president of a board of Medical Officers
convened per pars 33 and 34, S.O. 122, Haqrs of the Army, May 24" 1900.

In addition to the above I investigated and reported upon certain cases
of yellow fever at Pinar del Rio Barracks, Cuba, per par 4 S.O. 65, Haqr's
Dept of Havana and Pinar del Rio, July 21" 1900.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully.
Your obedient servant. Walter Reed, Major and Surgeon, U.S. Army.
Adjt. Genl's. Office.
AUG 7 - 1900
[unclear]
July 31, 1900
Reed, Walter
Major & Surgeon U.S. Army
